stories.text:
We're about 35 employees and just switched to Gusto for 2022.

I'm having trouble with just about everything.

I've talked to support 15-20 times so far and they seems to not know answers to much. Everything is upgraded to a "specialist".

When I do get answers, every support person has a different answer.

For example:

Sick hours didn't show up on Jan 1st (like the policy stated). First support person had me experiment with creating multiple policies to triage the issue, eventually telling me I had to enter hours manually.

Second time I called in, the person told me they accrue hours only after the first payroll.

After the first payroll, only SOME of the employees accrued sick time off. Now the issue has been upgraded to a "specialist".

This is only one of a handful of such issues I'm facing.

Curious to see if this experience is common with others? I did trials with BambooHR and Gusto, and now regretting my decision.
stories.title: Ask HN: Anyone used Gusto? Product and support seem buggy/disorganized
Ukraine’s official websites hit by cyberhack amid high tensions with Russia

stories.text: I am fairly sure I remember a Linux desktop back in the 1990s with a moderately-complete classic MacOS look and feel. I think it was called "Sparta" or something like that. I can't find a trace with Google. Not just a window manager like MLVWM. Not just a skin or theme for an existing desktop (like Platinum on Xfce). Functionally, more like Ben Szymanski's "Classic Finder" for OS X.
stories.title: Ask HN: Can anyone remember a Classic macOS-like desktop for Linux?
